DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the present study is to determine whether or not primary human mammary epithelial cells are competent for use in molecular studies of transepithelial electrophysiology focusing on the function of the tight junction protein claudin 3. Human breast Tissue will be removed from mastectomy specimens and used as a source to generate epithelial cells for study.
DOC.brief_title: The Biology of Claudin 3 in Primary Human Mammary Epithelial Cell Culture
DOC.criteria: Subjects of this pilot study are limited to those female patients who are undergoing therapeutic or prophylactic mastectomy procedures conducted by the department of Surgery at HUMC. From within this population, no exclusion criteria shall be applied based on age, race, ethnicity, gender, HIV status, or menopause.
